studio.description:
You find yourself in a studio. A standard kind of place. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You make out a case![if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The case contains [a list of things in the c_0]. You check the price tag that hangs off the case. Seventy dollars?! That's ridiculous! Do you know my friend, they work for the government? I'm sure my friend could get you one of those for 95 bucks![end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

There is an unguarded exit to the north. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going west.

spare room.description:
You are in a spare room. It seems to be pretty typical here. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You see a workbench. The workbench is normal.[if there is something on the s_0] On the workbench you see [a list of things on the s_0]. It doesn't get more TextWorld than this![end if][if there is nothing on the s_0] Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though.[end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going east. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

bar.description:
You make a grand eccentric entrance into a bar.



You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going west.

closet.description:
You've just shown up in a closet. You start to take note of what's in the room.



 There is [if d_4 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading west. You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unguarded. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded.

launderette.description:
You are in a launderette. A typical one. You can barely contain your excitement.

 Look over there! a cabinet.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The cabinet contains [a list of things in the c_1].[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] The cabinet is empty! What a waste of a day![end if] You make out a bench. [if there is something on the s_1]You see [a list of things on the s_1] on the bench.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of trash. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?[end if]

 There is [if d_4 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading east. There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading south.

chamber.description:
You find yourself in a chamber. A typical one.

 If you haven't noticed it already, there seems to be something there by the wall, it's a box.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The box contains [a list of things in the c_2].[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] The box is empty, what a horrible day![end if] You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a mantelpiece. The mantelpiece is typical.[if there is something on the s_2] On the mantelpiece you see [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2] The mantelpiece appears to be empty.[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading west. There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

kitchen.description:
You are in a kitchen. A typical kind of place.

 You can make out a counter! [if there is something on the s_3]On the counter you see [a list of things on the s_3].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3]But there isn't a thing on it.[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading east. There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] portal leading north.

shower.description:
You arrive in a shower. An ordinary kind of place. You start to take note of what's in the room.

 You see a dresser.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The dresser contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] The dresser is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You see a rack. [if there is something on the s_4]On the rack you see [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4]But the thing is empty. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unguarded.

dish-pit.description:
You are in a dish-pit. A typical one. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You can see a shelf. The shelf is standard.[if there is something on the s_5] On the shelf you can make out [a list of things on the s_5]. There's something strange about this being here, but you can't put your finger on it.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_5] But the thing is empty, unfortunately. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if]

 There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading north. There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] portal leading south.

study.description:
Well, here we are in a study.



 There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading north. There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading south.
